title: Various ICEs when mis-implementing `drop_in_place` lang item

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I've found two ways to ICE when trying to provide a `drop_in_place` implementation (for some `no_core` code) - I've raised as one issue, because I think they're basically the same issue (rustc making assumptions about language item prototypes) but I'm happy to break up if preferred. ### Code ```Rust #[lang = "drop_in_place"] #[inline] unsafe fn drop_in_place(_to_drop: *mut i32) {} ``` ```Rust #[lang = "drop_in_place"] #[inline] unsafe fn drop_in_place(_to_drop: *mut T, _extra: U) {} ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.48.0-nightly (0da580074 2020-09-22) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu ``` ### Error output First example (too few generics): ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 0 but the index is 0', /rustc/0da58007451a154da2480160429e1604a1f5f0ec/compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/subst.rs:302:43 ```
Backtrace
